Subject: Ejemplo de algoritmo
Text: An example of an algorithm in the field of cooking could be how to make croquettes. The steps of this algorithm would be as follows: Step 1: Chop the ham into small pieces, Step 2: Put in a frying pan a little butter, a tablespoon of flour...

Subject: Historia del algoritmo
Text: Around 300 B.C. in Hellenistic Greece, the mathematician Euclid wrote 'Elements', a work that would lay the foundations for the geometry of the next millennia, that text includes his famous algorithm for finding the greatest common divisor.

Subject: Historia del algoritmo
Text: Humans have created, modified and used algorithms throughout history. More than 4500 years ago the Sumerians illustrated on clay tablets a repetitive method used to equally distribute the grain harvest among a varying number of men.

Subject: Ejemplo de algoritmo de recomendación
Text: Spotify, YouTube or Instagram also work with recommendation algorithms. On their success, i.e. how accurate they are in guessing what content users will like, depends not only the profitability of the brands that offer them, but also the user experience on the channel itself. If when you go into Spotify and click on the Radio option, songs that hurt your ears were playing, wouldn't you repeat?

Subject: Ejemplo de algoritmo
Text: Edgerank is the name of Facebook's algorithm and is responsible for determining which posts you see every time you access the social network. No, it's not about the latest ones that all your contacts have published, but about those that Edgerank thinks may be of interest to you. So if you haven't heard from your old classmate in a while, blame this algorithm.

Subject: Ejemplo de algoritmo
Text: Google's PageRank algorithm is perhaps the best known algorithm in the digital world. Its function is to select the order of the links that appear when you insert a word or set of words in the search box. But in the king of search engines also operate other algorithms, less known, which are responsible for filtering the results by country of origin, language ... in addition to selecting what paid content (ads) each user sees at that time of day and for that keyword.

Subject: Partes del algoritmo
Text: The parts of which an algorithm is composed are the inputs, the processing or instructions, and the outputs or the result obtained.

Subject: Input del algoritmo
Text: An example of input in the field of computer science could be the web pages detected by the search engine spider.

Subject: Input del algoritmo
Text: The input is the data on which the instructions are applied.

Subject: Clasificación de los algoritmos
Text: The third criterion that can be used for their classification is based on their strategy to reach a result. In this group we can mention probabilistic, heuristic, greedy, scaling and deterministic algorithms.

Subject: Input del algoritmo
Text: An example of input in the field of cooking could be the ingredients of a recipe.

Subject: Clasificación de los algoritmos
Text: Depending on the criterion used, different classifications are applied to algorithms. For example, if we use the classification by the system of signs with which the steps to be followed in the algorithm are described, we can differentiate two types, qualitative algorithms: those whose steps are verbal instructions and quantitative algorithms: those that follow instructions of numerical calculations.

Subject: Características de los algoritmos
Text: One of the characteristics of algorithms is that they are complete, i.e., all possibilities of the problem must be considered in the solution.

Subject: Características de los algoritmos
Text: One of the characteristics of algorithms is that they are deterministic, that is, given the same data or input, the output is always the same.

Subject: Características de los algoritmos
Text: One of the characteristics of algorithms is that algorithms always give a result at the end.

Subject: Características de los algoritmos
Text: One of the characteristics of algorithms is that the rules that compose it are applied in an orderly fashion.

Subject: Características de los algoritmos
Text: One of the characteristics of algorithms is that the instructions or rules are finite, i.e., there are a certain number of them.

Subject: Definición de agente inteligente
Text: An algorithm is a set of defined rules that allows a problem to be solved, in a certain way, by means of systematic (not necessarily ordered) and finite operations. These instructions, defined and ordered according to the data, solve the problem or task.

Subject: Definición de agente inteligente
Text: The most commonly used definition of algorithm is the following: sequence of instructions to solve a problem.

Subject: Clasificación de los algoritmos
Text: If they are classified on the basis of their function, three main groups can be established such as search algorithms, sorting algorithms and routing algorithms.

Subject: Ejemplo de reglas de asociación
Text: Learning association rules tells us that if a user buys, for example, a book, how likely it is that he will buy another book, where these two books are related because other users bought them both.

Subject: Definición de reglas de asociación
Text: An association rule is defined as an implication of the type 'if X then Y', where X and Y are itemsets or individual items. The left-hand side of the rule is called the antecedent or lenft-hand-side (LHS) and the right-hand side is called the consequent or right-hand-side (RHS).

Subject: Definición de reglas de asociación
Text: Association rules are logical implications of the type 'If X, then Y'. They can be obtained from a decision tree or deduced directly from the training set. For example, if we have a data set with information of the height (X), width (Y) and depth (Z) of an object and we want to classify it as large or small we can have rules like: If (X > 20) then large, If (X <= 20) then small, If (X > 10) and (Y>10) then large.

Subject: Definición de realidad aumentada
Text: Augmented Reality (AR) is a technology that allows us to superimpose virtual elements on our vision of reality.

Subject: Ejemplo de realidad aumentada
Text: The most famous example of augmented reality in recent years is Pokémon Go, which superimposes elements of the game on the real world. Pokémon appear on your screen as if you were viewing them through the lens of your device's camera.

Subject: Definición de realidad aumentada
Text: Augmented Reality is the set of technologies that allow to visualize, through some kind of device, the real world with some "extras". These extras can be graphics, photos or videos, interactive or not, that add information to what a human being would normally see. It differs from Virtual Reality in that the latter does not incorporate real elements, it is completely virtual, in the sense that what is seen, is generated by a computer.

Subject: Definición de realidad aumentada
Text: Augmented reality is a set of techniques that allow the application of virtual elements on a representation of physical reality.

Subject: Definición de autoencoder
Text: Autoencoders are artificial neural networks, trained in an unsupervised manner, that aim to first learn the encoded representations of our data and then generate the input data (as closely as possible) from the learned encoded representations.

Subject: Definición de autoencoder
Text: An autoencoder is a type of artificial neural network used to learn efficient encodings from unlabeled data. The encoding is validated and refined by attempting to regenerate the input from the encoding.

Subject: Definición de autoencoder
Text: Autoencoders are a particular type of artificial neural network that is divided into two parts: the encoder and the decoder. They function as a normal multilayer neural network and are used to learn efficient encodings from unlabeled data. The hidden layers of the network get smaller and smaller in the encoder portion and then grow again in the decoder. The idea is to be able to reduce the amount of information needed to represent the information. This minimal portion of data is used to reconstruct the input signal in the decoding phase.

Subject: Definición de big data
Text: The term 'big data' refers to data that is so big, or complex that are difficult or impossible to process with traditional methods. The act ofaccessing and storing large amounts of information for analytics has been around for a long time.

Subject: Uso de big data
Text: What makes Big Data so useful for many companies is the fact that it provides answers to many questions that companies didn't even know they had. In other words, it provides a benchmark. With such a large amount of information, the data can be shaped or tested in any way the company sees fit. In doing so, organizations are able to identify problems in a more understandable way.

Subject: Definición de big data
Text: Big Data refers to a large amount of data, both structured and unstructured, that cannot be analyzed by conventional algorithms. Think of the DNA of the organisms that inhabit our planet, or the number of TikTok videos that are posted every day. Conventional algorithms get "choked" with so much data and different algorithms and strategies need to be used.

Subject: Blockchain example
Text: Blockchain provides a number of advantages associated with authentication and security. Therefore, blockchain will have an impact on the telecommunications sector, especially in terms of network and business management. It helps to improve business competitiveness and customer satisfaction.

Subject: Ejemplo de blockchain
Text: Blockchain enables more efficient management of payments and premium collections, as well as reducing operational costs by streamlining all processes. As mentioned above, blockchain is also very useful for detecting fraud and brings a lot of transparency to actions.

Subject: Ejemplo de blockchain
Text: The banking sector was the first to incorporate blockchain into its operational processes, as this technology was born in a transactional environment. Blockchain can facilitate the commercialization of certain banking products and ensure speed in operations, in addition to avoiding fraud risks.

Subject: Definición de blockchain
Text: Blockchain, or blockchain, is a distributed digital ledger that stores data of any type.

Subject: Definición de blockchain
Text: Blockchain is a distributed, decentralized system used to store blocks of transactions and verify them with a network of nodes. These blocks cannot be altered once verified.

Subject: Definición de blockchain
Text: Blockchain is a set of technologies that allow for a secure, decentralized, synchronized and distributed record of digital transactions, without the need for third party intermediation.

Subject: Definición de blockchain
Text: Blockchain is a system for digital transfer based on the distribution of information in several independent computers that record and validate such information, eliminating intermediaries. If we talk about bank transfers, these could be done without the need for a centralized computer (a bank).

Subject: Ejemplo de bot
Text: Bots used in political campaigns are called social bots, and are often used to generate content on social networks and thus generate or support certain ideas or influence political processes, for example by denigrating opposing candidates or to grow the popularity of a particular candidate in presidential or parliamentary elections. This political use of the bot that generates content on the Internet has a growing presence around the world, and various studies have found that the percentage of activity generated by bots during elections in many cases exceeds 10% of the publications made.

Subject: Tipos de bot
Text: Some types of bots are the following chat bots, web crawlers, social bots, malicious bots.

Subject: Ejemplo de bot
Text: In the video game environment, a bot is a program that is capable of playing the game itself (also known as a borg). The quality of the bot in this case is determined by its ability to beat (and on what terms) the game. Bots for CRPG (computer role-playing games) games are particularly well known as these types of applications require a great capacity for strategy to win them. It is also very common to use this term in first-person shooter games, where they replace a human player when no opponents are available or in offline play.

Subject: Definición de bot
Text: A bot is a software application that is programmed to perform certain tasks. Bots are automated, meaning that they run according to your instructions without a human user having to manually launch them each time. Bots often mimic or replace the behavior of a human. They typically perform repetitive tasks and can do them much faster than people would.

Subject: Definición de bot
Text: A bot is a computer program capable of performing repetitive tasks. It commonly operates on the Internet and usually simulates the behavior that a person would have, doing the same thing but automatically. Conversational bots that function as virtual assistants or chatbots are an example (Siri, Alexa, Cortana...). Another example are the bots in charge of performing the indexing of web pages, so that when you do a search you find what you want.

Subject: Ejemplo de ciencia de datos
Text: One possible use can be the identification of cyber threats from access data to systems and network resources. Patterns are searched for and alerts are raised when situations are detected that do not respond to a predefined pattern.

Subject: Ventajas de la ciencia de datos
Text: A data science platform decreases redundancies and fosters innovation by enabling teams to share code, results and reports. It eliminates workflow bottlenecks by simplifying administration and incorporating best practices.

Subject: Expertos en ciencia de datos
Text: Data science practitioners are called data scientists and combine a variety of expertise to analyze data collected from the web, smartphones, customers, sensors and other sources to derive useful information.

Subject: Definición de ciencia de datos
Text: Data science combines multiple fields, such as statistics, scientific methods, artificial intelligence (AI) and data analytics to extract value from data.

Subject: Definición de ciencia de datos
Text: Data science is an interdisciplinary field that involves scientific methods, processes and systems for extracting knowledge or a better understanding of data in its various forms, whether structured or unstructured.

Subject: Definición de ciencia de datos
Text: Data science encompasses tools that enable useful information to be extracted from data sets. It mainly includes statistics and computer science (specifically data mining and machine learning techniques). It has become very popular since the concept of Big Data was coined. Data scientists constitute a new academic profile. There are several master's degrees that specialize in Data Science and it is likely that soon there will also be specific degree programs...

Subject: Definición de árbol de decisión
Text: It is the representation of a set of rules for making a decision. There is a learning model that learns these rules based on examples. The trick is to identify those decisions that best divide the set of examples. For example, if we have to classify a shopping basket into a Christmas basket or a normal basket, whether a sweet bread or a nougat is inside is almost decisive. The more relevant decisions will be higher up in the hierarchy of the resulting tree.

Subject: Definición de árbol de decisión
Text: A decision tree is a prediction model used in various fields ranging from artificial intelligence to economics.

Subject: Definición de árbol de decisión
Text: A decision tree diagram allows you to evaluate through a graphical representation the possible outcomes, costs and consequences of a decision tree.of a complex decision. This method is very useful for analyzing quantitative data and making a decision based on numbers.

Subject: Definición de variables dummy
Text: Dummy or indicator variables are used to identify categories or classes to which the observations belong.

Subject: Definición de variables dummy
Text: A Dummy Variable is a variable that is created when the original variable cannot be used. For example, if we have a categorical variable such as "color" (which can take values "green", "blue" or "red") and we want to measure distances between different instances, we will have to convert it into numeric values. One option is to use one-hot encoding and convert the variable "color" into three new dummy variables (one per color). These three variables will be binary and can take the value of 0 or 1, but only one of these three variables will be 1 at a time. This way we can compare colors using a hamming distance.

Subject: Definición de variables dummy
Text: In statistics and econometrics, particularly in regression analysis, a dummy variable is one that takes only the value 0 or 1 to indicate the absence or presence of some categorical effect that can be expected to change the outcome.

Subject: Ejemplo de aprendizaje federado
Text: The technique can train an algorithm with data stored in multiple different hospitals without that data leaving their facilities or having to be copied to a technology company's servers. To do this, separate models at each hospital must first be trained on the available local data. Then, all the models are sent to a central server where they are combined into a master model. As each hospital acquires more data, it can download the latest master model, update it with its new information and send it back to the central server. During this process, the raw data is never exchanged; the only thing that is transferred is the algorithms, which cannot be reverse-engineered to reveal that data.

Subject: Definición de aprendizaje federado
Text: Federated learning is a machine learning technique that allows to train an algorithm in a decentralized way,using their own (private and local) data. It is also known as Collaborative Learning, as each user learns a model with their own data, but only shares this model (data remains private) with other users.

Subject: Definición de modelos generativos
Text: Generative models allow a machine to 'learn' the patterns that exist in the data they are trained on and from that learning, they are able to generate similar data that in some cases can be almost as 'real' as that which was initially used for training.

Subject: Ejemplo de modelos generativos
Text: In particular, Generative Adversarial Neural Networks (GAN's) can generate new images that look like or are similar to the images they were trained with, but are individually different from all of them.

Subject: Definición de modelos generativos
Text: A generative model is a deep architecture endowed with learning algorithms whose mission is to learn any type of data distribution, all this applied within the unsupervised learning paradigm.

Subject: Definición de modelos generativos
Text: Generative models are so called because they generate new examples, similar to those of the data set they were trained on. They are also known as Generative Antagonistic Networks or GANs.English). They are basically two models (artificial neural networks) that compete with each other: one generates new examples and the other tries to discriminate between real and synthetic examples. Gradual y the generator becomes so good that the discriminator is unable to distinguish fact from fiction.

Subject: Definición de grafo
Text: You can represent a problem as a graph, for example, the connection between people in a social network. Each point in the graph is a person and the lines connecting them represent friendships. Using that data structure it is possible to apply specific graph theory algorithms to: Detect communities, Identify influential people, Measure the popularity of a person, Detect who controls the flow of information. and much more!

Subject: Definición de grafo
Text: A graph is a symbolic representation of the constituent elements of a system or set, by means of graphical schemes.

Subject: Definición de grafo
Text: A graph is a non-empty set of objects called vertices (or nodes) and a selection of pairs of vertices, called edges, which can be oriented or not.

Subject: Definición de Unidad de Procesamiento Gráfico (GPU)
Text: GPU- accelerated computing is the use of a graphics processing unit (GPU) in conjunction with a CPU to accelerate the performance of deep learning, analytics and engineering applications.

Subject: Definición de Unidad de Procesamiento Gráfico (GPU)
Text: A GPU is a processor designed to handle graphics operations. This includes 2D and 3D calculations, although GPUs excel primarily at rendering 3D graphics.

Subject: Definición de Unidad de Procesamiento Gráfico (GPU)
Text: A graphics processing unit (GPU) or graphics processor is a coprocessor dedicated to graphics processing or floating point operations, to lighten the workload of the central processor/CPU in applications such as video games or interactive 3D applications.

Subject: Definición de Unidad de Procesamiento Gráfico (GPU)
Text: GPUs are like CPUs but for graphics. They are mathematical co-processors designed for graphics processing and floating point operations. In other words, they help the CPU to process everything related to 3D applications, video games, ... Graphics cards that are used for something other than graphics processing are called GP-GPUs or general purpose GPUs. These GPUs are capable of processing numerical calculations much faster.than the CPU and can work in parallel. They've been to blame for the boom in the whole thing around Deep Learning.

Subject: Definición de computación Ecológica
Text: Green Computing refers to the efficient use of computational resources while minimizing environmental impact, maximizing economic viability and ensuring social duties.

Subject: Definición de computación Ecológica
Text: Green Computing refers to computing that makes responsible use of resources. It attempts, for example, to minimize energy use, making efficient use of energy and reducing environmental impact. One idea to be 'greener' is to have a data center that can be used by several researchers and thus make better use of resources without the need to duplicate them. For this, it is essential to have a good communications network to connect them.

Subject: Definición de función hash
Text: A Hash Function or Digest Function is a mathematical function that transforms a set of data into an alphanumeric code of fixed length. Regardless of the amount of data used, the resulting code will always have the same number of characters. Hash functions are used in cryptography (e.g., digital signature), random number generation, text search systems, and much more. Hash functions are also part of data structures used in many artificial intelligence algorithms.

Subject: Definición de función hash
Text: A hash function, also known by the hybrid hash function, converts one or more input elements to a function into another element. They are also known as extract function, from digest function, extract function and by the hybrid digest function.

Subject: Definición de función hash
Text: A cryptographic hash function is a mathematical algorithm that transforms any arbitrary block of data into a new series of characters with a fixed length. Regardless of the length of the input data, the output hash value will always have the same length.

Subject: Definición de tabla hash
Text: Hash tables are data structures that are used to store a large number of data over which very efficient search and insert operations are required. A hash table stores a set of '(key, value)' pairs.

Subject: Definición de tabla hash
Text: A hash table, associative array, hashing, hash map, hash map, scatter table or fragmented table is a data structure that associates keys or keys with values. The main operation it efficiently supports is lookup: it allows access to stored items from a generated key.

Subject: Definición de tabla hash
Text: A hash table is a data structure that relates a value called 'key' to one or more other elements. It has the particularity of performing very fast search operations thanks to the use of hash functions. The keys of the hash table are encoded in such a way that there is only one possible place within the structure where each piece of data can be stored. So, searching for it is a matter of applying a mathematical function and going to look for the data where indicated.

Subject: Definición de agente inteligente
Text: An intelligent agent is a program with at least the following characteristics: autonomous, sociable, responsive, self-initiated. There are different types of intelligent agents and even multi-agent systems, where several agents cooperate to achieve a common goal. An example of intelligent agents are vacuum cleaner robots. Some are so smart that they can create a map of your home so they don't always go through the same place and make sure your whole house is clean.

Subject: Definición de agente inteligente
Text: An intelligent agent is a perceptual system capable of interpreting and processing the information it receives from its environment, acting accordingly according to the data it collects and processes. The way this entity acts is logical and rational based on the reactions of the normal behavior of a particular system. It uses sensors to receive information and actuators to exercise its functions.

Subject: Definición de agente inteligente
Text: An intelligent agent, is an entity capable of perceiving its environment, processing such perceptions and responding or acting in its environment rationally, i.e., in a correct manner and tending to maximize an expected result.

Subject: Ejemplo de Internet de las Cosas (IoT)
Text: Garageio is a smart garage door app that allows you to monitor and control your garage from home by connecting to the app. It is part of the new generation of connected products that is attracting a lot of interest these days: products that can be monitored and controlled remotely.

Subject: Ejemplo de Internet de las Cosas (IoT)
Text: Gemini 2 smart shoes are sneakers that can be charged wirelessly. Among their many features are, in addition to wireless charging, they come with tangle-free cables and connection to cell phones. The shoes transmit information to the device to which they are connected, such as distance traveled or heart rate.

Subject: Características de Internet de las Cosas (IoT)
Text: With this technology used in homes or businesses, it is possible to easily know if one of the devices needs to be fixed or replaced. This makes it possible to plan ahead and avoid major problems.

Subject: Características de Internet de las Cosas (IoT)
Text: IoT refers to a growing network of physical objects that are connected to the Internet. These smart devices are becoming increasingly prevalent in everyday life, as they can help manage time, energy, resources, goods, services and much more.

Subject: Definición de Internet de las Cosas (IoT)
Text: The Internet of Things is a concept that refers to a digital interconnection of everyday objects with the Internet. It is a new paradigm in which different devices interact with each other without human intervention. An example of IoT usage is activity wristbands that can be used in Connected Health issues to know a person's status. It could detect if you are a sleepwalker...

Subject: Definición de aprendizaje automático
Text: Machine learning is a branch within AI that allows a computer to learn based on examples. They can be grouped into: Supervised, Unsupervised, Semi-supervised.

Subject: Definición de árbol de Merkle
Text: A Hash Tree or Merkle Tree is a tree-like data structure in which: A) Each leaf node is labeled with the result of applying a Hash Function to the data corresponding to that leaf. A) Each internal node is labeled with the result of applying a Hash Function to the concatenation of the labels of its descendant nodes. Merkle Trees are used to record peer-to-peer transactions, Blockchain type. But don't worry, I'll soon make a video explaining how they work...

Subject: Definición de árbol de Merkle
Text: A Merkle hash tree or Merkle tree or hash tree is a tree-like data structure, binary or otherwise, in which each non-leaf node is labeled with the hash of the concatenation of the labels or values of its child nodes. They are a generalization of hash lists and hash chains.

Subject: Definición de árbol de Merkle
Text: Merkle trees are a data structure created with the objective of facilitating the verification of large amounts of organized data by relating them by means of various cryptographic and information management techniques.

Subject: Definición de metadatos
Text: Metadata is information that accompanies the data itself. For example, when you take a photograph, the image itself is accompanied by metadata that includes information about who the author is, his/her GPS position, the date and time, etc. Metadata can be: Descriptive such as EXIF data, Administrative such as copyright, Structural related to other data, Language such as XML

Subject: Definición de metadatos
Text: Metadata is data about data. In other words, it is information that is used to describe the data contained in something such as a web page, document or file. Another way to think of metadata is as a brief explanation or summary of what the data is.

Subject: Definición de metadatos
Text: Metadata is data that describes other data. In general, a group of metadata refers to a group of data that describe the contentinformation about an object that is referred to as a resource. The concept of metadata is analogous to the use of indexes to locate objects rather than data.

Subject: Ejemplo de metaverso
Text: Video calls, which after the pandemic have become so popular, could in the future be replaced by virtual meetings in the metaverse. That is, instead of connecting our cameras we would see how our avatars meet.

Subject: Definición de metaverso
Text: The term metaverse comes from a 1992 novel called 'Snow Crash,' and is a term that has settled to describe visions of three-dimensional or virtual workspaces. This metaverse, therefore, means a virtual world in which we can interact, and which has been created to resemble an external reality.

Subject: Ejemplo de metaverso
Text: The possibility of testing the operation of new machines or systems very reliably before final manufacture, with the consequent saving of billions of euros in tests before the launch of a new patent.

Subject: Definición de metaverso
Text: The Metaverse is a virtual world, one to which we will connect using a series of devices that will make us think that we are really inside it, interacting with all its elements. It will be like actually teleporting to a whole new world through virtual reality glasses and other complements that will allow us to interact with it.

Subject: Definición de metaverso
Text: A metaverse is a universe created in cyberspace. These universes could be accessed with virtual reality and in which, ideally, it should be possible to travel through different experiences in a shared way with millions of users. First attempts at metaverses could be Roblox, Fortnite or Animal Crossing: New Horizons. These new metaverses are still being imagined... it is a new field to explore and soon we will have countless universes to "live" in.

Subject: Definición de modelo
Text: AI models (machine learning and deep learning) help automate logical inference and decision making in business intelligence.

Subject: Definición de modelo
Text: All models in AI generally learn a function F that relates the input values x and the output values y. y = F(x). The model is a representation of the x values that have been used to train it. The more accurate the model, the better it will represent these values and thus be a better predictor when faced with new examples.

Subject: Definición de modelo
Text: A model is an analytical method that allows a system, by itself, without human intervention and in an automated way, to learn to discover patterns, trends and relationships in the data, and thanks to this knowledge, in each interaction with new information, better perspectives are offered.

Subject: Definición de modelo
Text: A machine learning model is a file that has been trained to recognize certain types of patterns. You can train a model with a set of data, and provide it with an algorithm that it can use to find out and get information from that data.

Subject: Definición de sobreajuste
Text: Overfitting is the consequence of creating a pattern that fits a set of examples so very, very well that when you present it with new examples that are slightly different, it is unable to identify them. It fails to generalize the learned pattern. Imagine that you generate a model (a neural network, for example) based on many images of white, brown and orange cats. When you give it a new image of a cat with those colors, it identifies it correctly as a cat, but if you give it an image of a black cat... it will tell you that it is not a cat at all...

Subject: Definición de sobreajuste
Text: Overfitting is the act of making a model so tight to the training data that it does not generalize well to the test data.

Subject: Definición de sobreajuste
Text: Overfitting occurs when a machine learning system is overtrained or overtrained with anomalous data, which causes the algorithm to 'learn' patterns that are not general. It learns specific features but not the general patterns, the concept. More complex models tend to overfit more than simpler models. Also, given the same model, the smaller the amount of data, the more likely that model is to overfit.

Subject: Definición de Prolog
Text: Prolog, from the French PROgrammation en LOGique, is an interpreted logic programming language commonly used in the field of Artificial Intelligence.

Subject: Definición de Prolog
Text: PROLOG is a programming language based on the logic paradigm, this language is mainly used for artificial intelligence applications. The development of PROLOG started in 1970 with Alain Coulmeauer and Philippe Roussel.

Subject: Definición de Prolog
Text:
Prolog is an interpreted programming language developed in France in the '70s. In this language there are two types of clauses: Facts and Rules. Facts are always true, while Rules define a relationship between different Facts and/or Rules. Here is how to solve in PROLOG a factorial with two Facts and a Rule:
factorial(0, 1).
factorial(1, 1).
factorial(N, F) :- 
 N>0, 
 N1 is N - 1,
factorial(N1, F1),
 F is N * F1.

Subject: Funcionalidad del aprendizaje por refuerzo
Text: In Reinforcement Learning we do not have an 'output label', so it is not supervised and although these algorithms learn by themselves, they are not unsupervised, where we try to classify groups taking into account some distance between samples.

Subject: Definición de aprendizaje por refuerzo
Text: Reinforcement learning is an area of machine learning inspired by behavioral psychology, whose occupation is to determine what actions a software agent should choose in a given environment in order to maximize some notion of "reward" or accrued reward.

Subject: Definición de aprendizaje por refuerzo
Text: Reinforcement learning is a type of machine learning whereby a decision made by an algorithm is followed by a reinforcement (positive or negative). This 'encourages' or 'punishes' these decisions allowing the algorithm to learn. This type of learning is typically used in robotics. It could be used to teach a robotic arm to pour drinks, giving positive reinforcement when it succeeds in pouring a drink and negative reinforcement when.

Subject: Ejemplos de aprendizaje por refuerzo
Text: Reinforcement learning can be used in robots, for example in mechanical arms where instead of teaching instruction by instruction to move, we can let it make 'blind' attempts and reward it when it does well.

Subject: Ejemplos de aprendizaje por refuerzo
Text: Reinforcement learning can be used to create "personalized websites" for each user. And if you think about it... it makes some sense to take the concept of "rewarding" the algorithm if it is right with the suggestions it makes to the user if he clicks or penalizing the model if its recommendations are not useful.

Subject: Ejemplos de aprendizaje por refuerzo
Text: Reinforcement learning can be used to decide how to shape an investment portfolio without human intervention.

Subject: Definición de smart data
Text: Smart Data appears as a result of Big Data. The concept of Smart Data refers to transforming long lists of numbers and data into valuable, responsive, useful information. Turning data into statistics using complicated algorithms that process Big data.

Subject: Definición de smart data
Text: Smart data refers to data that has been preprocessed and curated. This data is ready to be used, i.e. Machine Learning algorithms can be applied directly to it. We refer to big data when we perform raw data mining, in particular when we collect a large amount of data. Smart data, on the other hand, also collects a large amount of data, but also includes the added value of analyzing this data.

Subject: Definición de smart data
Text: We all know what Big Data is, it refers to the large volume of data that can be collected. On the other hand, Smart Data also collects a lot of data instantly, but in this case it has an added value compared to the first one, and that is that in addition to collecting a lot of information, the system is also capable of analyzing it.

Subject: Definición de sugar code
Text: Sugar coding is a term that refers to the elements added to a programming language to make its programming simpler (i.e., sweeter), without affecting its functionality. A) a = a + 1 can be written as a += 1. B) 1 < x and x < 10 can be written as 1 < x < 10. C) number = 1000000000 can be written as number = 1_000_000_000_000.

Subject: Definición de árbol
Text: Trees are undoubtedly one of the nonlinear data structures, used in computing, both to solve hardware and software problems. Directory trees are quite commonly used organizations by any computer user or programmer.

Subject: Definición de árbol
Text: A tree is a (possibly nonlinear) data structure composed of nodes, vertices and edges that is acyclic. A tree that has no nodes is called an empty or null tree. A tree that is not empty consists of a root node and potentially many levels of additional nodes that form a hierarchy.

Subject: Definición de árbol
Text: A tree is a data structure. It is a type of network with a hierarchical structure, like a tree in nature. It has the particularity of not having cycles. Using this data structure it is easier to solve some common problems such as: Prefix search in character strings, Representation of mathematical formulas, HTML representation, Decision making. And much more!

Subject: Definición de árbol
Text: Trees are the most used data structures, but also one of the most complex, Trees are characterized by storing their nodes in a hierarchical way and not in a linear way as the Linked Lists, Queues, Stacks, etc., of which we have already talked about in the past days.

Subject: Definición de máquina de Turing
Text: A Turing machine consists of an infinite tape divided into juxtaposed workspaces or cells that acts as memory, a head capable of reading and writing symbols on the tape and moving it from cell to cell right and left, a state register, and a finite instruction table or action table.

Subject: Definición de turing completo
Text: By Turing complete we mean that language which has a computational power equivalent to what is called the Universal Turing Machine. In other words, Alan Turing devised a system that could theoretically perform any kind of computation if unlimited physical resources were available.

Subject: Definición de turing completo
Text: A Turing Complete system is one that has a computational power equivalent to the Universal Turing Machine. In other words, a Turing Complete system can emulate a Universal Turing Machine and vice versa. As you will see, computer scientists and mathematicians also philosophize... Some examples are Lambda Calculus (type-free), Cellular Automata, Quantum Computers, Formal Grammars, and many others...

Subject: Definición de turing completo
Text: A system is said to be "Turing complete" in computer theory if it can be used to emulate a Turing machine, which is a theoretical construct designed by the mid-century mathematician and computer scientist Alan Turing.

Subject: Definición de máquina de Turing
Text: The Turing machine is a mental device devised by Alan Turing in the 1930s to answer one of the great questions posed by the mathematician David Hilbert in 1900.

Subject: Definición de máquina de Turing
Text: The Turing machine is a device created in 1936, which represents an idealized model of computing capable of storing/processing virtually infinite information. The system is a mathematical abstraction that is constructed in an extraordinarily simple way, but which facilitates the empirical verification of a wide range of questions on the theories of computability and/or complexity. Its ideation marked a major milestone in the history of computing, to the point of being considered as the origin of today's computers (and related technologies, such as tablets or cell phones).

Subject: Definición de máquina de Turing
Text: A Turing machine is a device that uses a table of rules to manipulate symbols on a data tape. A Turing machine is a formal model of computation capable of performing any computation (that a computer is capable of performing). Thanks to this theoretical model it is possible to categorize computational problems according to their complexity: A) Complexity P: Its solutions can be found in polynomial time by deterministic Turing machines. B) NP Complexity: Their solutions can be found in polynomial time by non-deterministic Turing machines.

Subject: Definición de test de Turing
Text: The Turing test consists of a human having a conversation with a computer and another person, but without knowing which of the two conversationalists is actually a machine. The goal of this experiment is to determine whether artificial intelligence can mimic human responses.

Subject: Definición de test de Turing
Text: The Turing test or Turing test is an examination of a machine's ability to exhibit intelligent behavior similar to or indistinguishable from that of a human being.

Subject: Definición de test de Turing
Text: The Turing test is a test to measure the intelligence of a machine. It consists of asking a machine and a human a series of questions. If the questioner is not able to distinguish who is the human and who is the machine, then the latter is said to be intelligent and to have passed the test. In 2014 an AI called Eugene was said to have passed the test, but it had only convinced 30% of the judges.... So I would say that no machine capable of completely fooling a human by impersonating someone of the same species has yet been developed.

Subject: Definición de subajuste
Text: It is hardly ever talked about, but it does exist. It happens when a too simple model is generated, unable to work even with the set of examples with which it is generated. It fails to identify a pattern. It may happen that you do not have enough data to generate the model. But don't worry... there are ways around this. For example, you can adjust the parameters of the algorithm you are using or try another type of algorithm that better fits the data.

Subject: Causa de subajuste
Text: If our training data are too few our machine will not be able to generalize the knowledge and will be incurring in an underfitting.

Subject: Definición de subajuste
Text: Underfitting refers to the failure of our model to generalize the knowledge we intend them to acquire.

Subject: Historia de xenobot
Text: The xenobot has been designed by a supercomputer called Deep Green which is located at the University of Vermont, although they have subsequently been developed at the Biology Laboratory at Tufts University in Massachusetts.

Subject: Definición de xenobot
Text: A xenobot is a robot that has been obtained from frog embryos through a sophisticated technological process. It is a historical milestone as it represents the first robot or biological machine that has been designed from scratch from a living organic matter.

Subject: Definición de xenobot
Text: A xenobot is a synthetic biological entity created from cells of embryos of the species Xenopus laevis, designed by a supercomputer specialized in determining configurations of its structure to provide it with specific properties that allow them to have programmed behaviors.

Subject: Definición de xenobot
Text: Xenobots (also called biobots) are half animal and half robots. They are the first self-replicating living robots. They were created thanks to African clawed frog embryo cells, and have been designed with a computer from specific biological building blocks based on an evolutionary algorithm. They are like little Pac- Man.
